q: Who is known as Andhra Kesari?
desc: T Prakasham is known as Andhra Kesari, a title recognizing his leadership in Andhra Pradesh.

q: Which personality is referred to as Babuji?
desc: Jagjivan Ram is popularly known as Babuji, a respected leader and social reformer in India.

q: Who is known by the popular name Bapu?
desc: Mahatma Gandhi is affectionately called Bapu, symbolizing his fatherly role in India's freedom struggle.

q: Which personality is called CR?
desc: C Rajagopalachari, a key freedom fighter and India's first Indian Governor-General, is known as CR.

q: Who is known as Desh Bandhu?
desc: Chitranjan Das is called Desh Bandhu, meaning 'Friend of the Nation,' for his contributions to India's freedom.

q: Which personality is referred to as Grand Old Man?
desc: Dadabhai Naoroji is known as the Grand Old Man for his pioneering role in India's political movement.

q: Who is not the part of the trio known as Lal, Bal, Pal?
desc: Lala Lajpat Rai, along with Bal Gangadhar Tilak and Bipin Chandra Pal, formed the famous Lal, Bal, Pal trio.

q: Which personality is known as Guruji?
desc: MS Golwalkar is known as Guruji, a title reflecting his leadership in the RSS organization.

q: Who is referred to as Gurudev?
desc: Rabindranath Tagore is called Gurudev, honoring his contributions to literature and philosophy.

q: Which personality is known as Iron Man?
desc: Vallabhbhai Patel is known as Iron Man for his strong leadership in unifying India.

q: Who is called Sparrow?
desc: Major Rajender Singh is nicknamed Sparrow, likely due to his small stature and significant military role.

q: Which personality is known as JP?
desc: Jayaprakash Narayan is known as JP, a prominent leader in India's socialist and freedom movements.

q: Who is referred to as Lady with the Lamp?
desc: Florence Nightingale is called Lady with the Lamp for her nursing work during the Crimean War.

q: Which personality is known as Lion of the Punjab?
desc: Lala Lajpat Rai is known as Lion of the Punjab for his fierce nationalism and leadership.

q: Who is called Little Corporal?
desc: Napoleon is nicknamed Little Corporal due to his early military rank and stature.

q: Which personality is known as Lokmanya?
desc: Bal Gangadhar Tilak is called Lokmanya, meaning 'accepted by the people,' for his popular leadership.

q: Who is referred to as Jawan?
desc: Jawan is a term used to refer to an Indian soldier, symbolizing the country's military personnel.

q: Which personality is known as Mahamanya?
desc: Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya is known as Mahamanya, honoring his great wisdom and contributions.

q: Who is called Man of Blood?
desc: Bismarck, the German statesman, is historically referred to as Man of Blood for his unification policies.

q: Which personality is known as Netaji?
desc: Subhash Chandra Bose is called Netaji, a title meaning 'Respected Leader,' for his revolutionary role.

q: Who is referred to as Nightingale of India?
desc: Sarojini Naidu is known as Nightingale of India for her poetic contributions and eloquence.

q: Which personality is known as Pandit ji?
desc: Jawaharlal Nehru is called Pandit ji, reflecting his scholarly background and leadership as India's first PM.

q: Who is called Shastri ji?
desc: Lal Bahadur Shastri is known as Shastri ji, a title honoring his simplicity and service as India's PM.

q: Who is known for the popular name associated with the freedom fighter Bipin Chandra Pal?
desc: Bipin Chandra Pal is part of the Lal, Bal, Pal trio, a significant group in India's freedom movement.

q: Which personality is linked to the title Man of Blood?
desc: Bismarck earned the title Man of Blood due to his role in the unification of Germany through warfare.

q: Who is known as the Lady with the Lamp in the context of nursing history?
desc: Florence Nightingale is celebrated as Lady with the Lamp for her nursing innovations during the Crimean War.

q: Which personality is associated with the title Lion of the Punjab?
desc: Lala Lajpat Rai's fierce nationalism earned him the title Lion of the Punjab.

q: Who is referred to as Little Corporal in military history?
desc: Napoleon was called Little Corporal due to his early military rank and short stature.

q: Which personality is known as Lokmanya for his widespread acceptance?
desc: Bal Gangadhar Tilak is known as Lokmanya, indicating his acceptance and leadership among the masses.
